ba018223-94cf-41d1-8986-3ae2a3b2c6ae.description: Being able to conduct research effectively is a critical skill of information literacy that is important in both academic and professional work. Once you have gathered background information on your topic and developed a thesis statement/research question, it’s time to start researching.
ba018223-94cf-41d1-8986-3ae2a3b2c6ae.name: Conducting Research

alignments.name: ACRL Framework for Information Literacy for Higher Education
alignments.description: This badge is aligned to the Searching as Strategic Exploration competency of the ACRL Framework for Information Literacy for Higher Education.

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be able to recognize that there are different types of information, develop a sound research strategy, and select useful search tools to search them effectively. This will be demonstrated and assessed through a compiled list of five sources relevant to their thesis statement/research question: a book, a peer-reviewed journal article, a magazine article, a news source, and a web source. With each source, the search tool and search strategy used to find it will be explained.
Initiating Research

002a6f4f-4500-405e-8511-ffd22e696555.description: Being able to conduct research effectively is a critical skill of information literacy that is important in both academic and professional work.Conducting research is an inquiry-based process that starts with recognizing when there is a need for information and identifying the focus of your investigation.
002a6f4f-4500-405e-8511-ffd22e696555.name: Initiating Research

alignments.name: ACRL Framework for Information Literacy for Higher Education
alignments.description: This badge is aligned to the Research as Inquiry and Searching as Strategic Exploration competencies of the ACRL Framework for Information Literacy for Higher Education.

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be able to identify an information need and engage in pre-search to gather background information to develop a thesis statement/research question. This will be demonstrated and assessed through a brief description of an effective pre-search process for the chosen topic and development of an appropriately focused thesis statement/research question.

5bc1561e-d73b-4ca2-84b1-b72743041e7c.description: Being able to conduct research effectively is a critical skill of information literacy that is important in both academic and professional work. When synthesizing information sources for an academic or professional need, it is expected that you will acknowledge the words and ideas of others that you used in your paper, proposal, presentation, etc.
5bc1561e-d73b-4ca2-84b1-b72743041e7c.name: Using & Citing Sources

alignments.name: ACRL Framework for Information Literacy for Higher Education
alignments.description: This badge is aligned to the Scholarship as Conversation and Information has Value competencies of the ACRL Framework for Information Literacy for Higher Education.

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be able to recognize the importance of giving credit to sources used in the research process, consult online guides to apply proper mechanics for formulating in-text citations and end-of-paper references, and discern the differences between quoting, paraphrasing, and summarizing. This will be assessed through the creation of a properly formatted bibliography, and an objective assessment where the learner identifies correct examples of quoting, paraphrasing, and summarizing.

1a952ff8-c12a-40c3-9005-02ba627bb3d5.description: Being able to conduct research effectively is a critical skill of information literacy that is important in both academic and professional work. When conducting research for an academic or professional need, you need to evaluate the sources you use for reliability, authority, validity, and accuracy.
1a952ff8-c12a-40c3-9005-02ba627bb3d5.name: Validating Information

alignments.name: ACRL Framework for Information Literacy for Higher Education
alignments.description: This badge is aligned to the Authority is Constructed and Contextual competency of the ACRL Framework for Information Literacy for Higher Education.

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be able to develop and employ the knowledge needed to assess the reliability, authority, validity, and accuracy of information sources. This will be assessed through an evaluation of three information sources for reliability, authority, validity, and accuracy using a rubric and a reflection on the usefulness of the skills needed to evaluate the information in both academic and professional applications.

c9a5ffe1-9e88-458c-bc3f-faa4d09f5a6f.description: Being able to conduct research effectively is a critical skill of information literacy that is important in both academic and professional work.The end stages of conducting research are typically drawing conclusions and sharing the knowledge you have gained with others.
c9a5ffe1-9e88-458c-bc3f-faa4d09f5a6f.name: Foundations in Research

alignments.name: ACRL Framework for Information Literacy for Higher Education
alignments.description: This badge is aligned to the Scholarship as Conversation and Information Creation as a Process competencies of the ACRL Framework for Information Literacy for Higher Education.

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be able to reflect on the iterative process of conducting research and recognize a variety of formats in which information may be disseminated. This will be assessed through the development of descriptive and evaluative annotations for each of the sources from the bibliography created for the Conducting Research Badge.
Initiating Research
Conducting Research
Validating Information
Using & Citing Sources

daf66ae2-7c90-478e-9393-6e31ad9ebc7a.description: It is critical for individuals in the job search process to be able to articulate why they are pursuing a particular career field. To obtain this badge, earners will go through a self-assessment process to determine their career pathway or direction. Earners will be able to articulate clearly how their skills, interests, and values are aligned with their career direction/path.
daf66ae2-7c90-478e-9393-6e31ad9ebc7a.name: Career Exploration

alignments.name: National Association of Colleges and Employers Career Readiness Competencies: Career & Self-Development
alignments.description: Proactively develop oneself and one’s career through continual personal and professional learning, awareness of one’s strengths and weaknesses, navigation of career opportunities, and networking to build relationships within and without one’s organization

badge_template_activities.title: In a format of their own choice, earners will develop their career plan for the next 1-5 years. They will assess how their chosen career path/direction aligns with their skills, interests, and values and how they concluded that this was an effective decision for themselves. Earners of this badge will be able to articulate how labor market information has influenced their direction. Additionally, they will be able to determine the educational requirements of their career path.

974facb8-b2e4-4356-8b86-c274e10e4326.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated foundational proficiencies in assessing animal behavior and welfare in animal-human interactions as they apply to animal-assisted interventions (AAI). Specifically, earners assess behaviors in AAI to maximize safety between clients and animals in professional settings. Additionally, they have developed a researched-based, species-specific evaluation of the historical relevance of companion animals to human beings.
974facb8-b2e4-4356-8b86-c274e10e4326.name: Animal Behavior in Animal-Assisted Therapies

alignments.name: AHAIO guidelines on education and training requirements for equine-assisted services
IAHAIO international guidelines on care, training, and welfare requirements for small animals in animal-assisted interventions

badge_template_activities.title: Developed a research-based ethogram for a species with which they will be working that includes objective descriptions of behaviors and categories of behaviors relevant to animal welfare and animal-human interactions. This allows them to identify benefits animals have on humans and their mental health, explain the evolutionary history between companion animals and humans, and demonstrate how, why and when an animal’s behavior and adaptation can be used within the therapy context.
Create action plans for welfare based on accurate evaluations of animal social, calming, and stress behaviors.

b35b0dfb-5cc9-4dcb-8008-22bec0595a16.description: AAI is an evolving field where new research continues to change the landscape of animal-assisted work, and suggestions for best practice are regularly updated. Earners of the Animal-Assisted Therapy Best Practices have demonstrated that they are able to apply scientific principles and theories to the development of animal-assisted activities and use these to evaluate AAI best practices related to their professional field.
b35b0dfb-5cc9-4dcb-8008-22bec0595a16.name: Animal-Assisted Therapy Best Practices

alignments.name: International Association of Human-Animal Interaction Organizations: Declaration and Position Statements of Best Practice
alignments.description: This badge is aligned to the International Association of Human-Animal Interaction Organizations (IAHAIO) declaration and position statements of best practice.

badge_template_activities.title: In this applied assessment, earners create a list of at least four references that are regularly updated with regard to suggested best practice. These can be groups/labs at universities, professional organizations, or groups/foundations that fund research in this field. Earners are then asked to analyze recommended best practices in AAI as it relates to their field and create a list of actions that they can use to apply these practices to their specific field and species of choice

cfd0a2f6-17a0-4dc1-aca2-346b8d6fc540.description: Climate change is the environmental issue that will define this century, and as such, it is the essential question facing humankind. How we respond will be complex and interconnected. Earners of this badge have quantified climate change data using scientific and mathematical tools; articulated a position on climate change demonstrating ethical reasoning; and engaged in dialogue regarding climate change using scientific evidence in order to address problems with sustainable solutions.
cfd0a2f6-17a0-4dc1-aca2-346b8d6fc540.name: Climate Change Reasoning

alignments.name: The Impacts of Climate Change on Human Health in the United States: A Scientific Assessment

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has quantified climate change data by constructing at least two graphs of temperature change through the last ~100 years for a community, and with a linear regression, evaluated what the slope of the line and regression coefficient suggest. The earner has also reported on additional climate data relating to precipitation and storm events, and the relevance of that data to their chosen community.

The earner has articulated and distributed an ethical communication on the climate crisis to a chosen community, by outlining how climate change is and will impact that community. This communication engages with scientific evidence to address climate problems with sustainable solutions.

bb67fc98-815d-40b3-bb41-1b27c46ff445.description: To effectively practice AAI, practitioners need to consider the legal requirements and regulations in their states which includes understanding the regulations at the state (and federal) level and recognizing the rules related to running the practice. Earners who have this badge can explain the laws and regulations relating to animal-assisted therapy and apply risk management planning plus disease and animal welfare considerations when working with humans and animals.
bb67fc98-815d-40b3-bb41-1b27c46ff445.name: Animal-Assisted Therapy Legislation, Rules, and Regulations

alignments.name: International Association of Human-Animal Interaction Organizations (IAHAIO) Position Statement on Zoonosis and Animal-Assisted Onterventions
AHAIO Definitions for AAI and Guidelines for Wellness of Animals Involved in AAI

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have investigated the legislation in their respective state (or state in which they plan to practice) and created a reference guide to demonstrate a compilation of information regarding their field of practice and any other forms that may be required to bring animals into this work. This guide includes names, links, and reference material related to any forms, policies, or other legal requirements related to their field of practice, working with animals, or species-specific regulations.

Earners will explain how each regulation or law affects their field of practice and their specific application of AAI Earners will also explain the link between each regulation and suggested best practice in their field, their intended therapeutic outcomes, and animal welfare. Additionally, earners will create plans on how they will adhere to each regulation and address challenges that may arise.

21c4c828-a52b-4889-855a-8e785e025d68.description: This is the Master Badge after completing all of the work in the previous three badges. The earner will have developed and demonstrated the necessary self-knowledge, professionalism, and communication ability to be able to approach the job search in the most effective way.
21c4c828-a52b-4889-855a-8e785e025d68.name: Career Master

alignments.name: National Association of Colleges and Employers Career Readiness Competencies: Career & Self-Development
alignments.description: Proactively develop oneself and one’s career through continual personal and professional learning, awareness of one’s strengths and weaknesses, navigation of career opportunities, and networking to build relationships within and without one’s organization.

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Etiquette and Communication
Professional Preparation Badge
Career Exploration

85585372-e7a0-4b0a-9906-f48b50108737.description: Community engagement involves working with social services or other community-based organizations in support of their mission or mandate. Earners have selected at least one such organization, identified and documented that organization’s mission and/or mandate, and have volunteered ten to twenty hours to that organization in support of its mission and/or mandate. These efforts are documented with a short, descriptive essay that recognizes the value of the recipient’s engagement.
85585372-e7a0-4b0a-9906-f48b50108737.name: Community Engagement I

badge_template_activities.title: Earners identify a social service and/or community-based organization with which to engage, reviewing and documenting that organization’s mission statement or public-facing mandates, communicating with that organization to establish volunteer efforts, fulfilling those efforts, and then document those efforts with a short, descriptive essay that recognizes the value of the recipient’s community engagement efforts to the organization and also to social groups that benefit from the efforts.

537de794-0955-4790-b63c-1a1531f01aba.description: Community engagement involves working with social services or other community-based organizations in support of their mission or mandate. Earners have earned Community Engagement I badge and cannot work with the same organization to earn this badge. Earners of this badge have selected an organization to support, identified and documented that organization’s mission and/or mandate, and have volunteered twenty to thirty hours to that organization in support of its mission and/or mandate.
537de794-0955-4790-b63c-1a1531f01aba.name: Community Engagement II

badge_template_activities.title: Identify a social service and/or community-based organization with which to engage, review and documenting that organization’s mission statement or public-facing mandates, communicate with that organization to establish volunteer efforts, fulfill those efforts, and then document those efforts with a short, descriptive essay that recognizes the value of the recipient’s community engagement efforts to the organization and also to social groups that benefit from the organization’s efforts.
Community Engagement I

32d60dfc-ed76-4adc-b3e7-00e8a6d8c2a9.description: Community engagement involves working with social services or other community-based organizations in support of their mission or mandate. Earners have earned Community Engagement I and II and cannot work with the same organizations to earn this badge. Earners of this badge have selected an organization to support, identified and documented that organization’s mission and/or mandate, and have volunteered thirty to forty hours to that organization in support of its mission and/or mandate.
32d60dfc-ed76-4adc-b3e7-00e8a6d8c2a9.name: Community Engagement III

badge_template_activities.title: Identify a social service and/or community-based organization with which to engage, review and documenting that organization’s mission statement or public-facing mandates, communicate with that organization to establish volunteer efforts, fulfill those efforts, and then document those efforts with a short, descriptive essay that recognizes the value of the recipient’s community engagement efforts to the organization and also to social groups that benefit from the organization’s efforts.
Community Engagement I
Community Engagement II

b8d36e66-c375-4249-9358-be4e67f4bbe4.description: Community Service is an excellent way to develop additional skills and knowledge for career preparation. Earners of the Husson Community Service Badge will be identifying community service opportunities within their area, establishing communications with a host site, and performing one to five hours of community service. To wrap up the experience, earners will then reflect on your experience in relation to their career aspirations.
b8d36e66-c375-4249-9358-be4e67f4bbe4.name: Community Service

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be identifying community service opportunities within their area, establishing communications with the host site, and performing one to five hours of community service. Students will then reflect on their experience in relation to their career aspirations. These substantial reflections are then submitted and reviewed by an advisor.

dc9cb909-07d7-450b-ba18-3f8dd5725451.description: Understanding the fundamentals of research design is an important step in the process of conducting research. In every field of study, research is conducted using valid and up-to-date sources, clear methodologies with internal validity, and ethical and systematic approaches. Earners of this badge have identified a specific research question, explained how their question relates to a field of academic research, described a method of analysis, and cited academic references in APA format.
dc9cb909-07d7-450b-ba18-3f8dd5725451.name: Fundamentals of APA Research Design

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge are asked to compose a research project, such as an Institutional Review Board (IRB) proposal, that includes a specific research question and an associated literature review that frames the research question’s relevance to an academic field. The project must describe and cites academic references with APA format.

5c1fd00d-eaf0-4ea0-8268-5253488c7ec8.description: Employers are looking for health profession graduates with experience in interprofessional collaborative practice and teamwork. Husson provides multiple opportunities for students to participate in meaningful interprofessional learning that goes beyond attendance at IPE events. The distinction will provide Evidence of IPE experience for professional portfolios and an indicator to accompany regalia at graduation.
5c1fd00d-eaf0-4ea0-8268-5253488c7ec8.name: Interprofessional Honors Distinction

alignments.name: Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE) Standard 11
alignments.description: The curriculum prepares all students to provide entry-level, patient-centered care in a variety of practice settings as a contributing member of an interprofessional team. In the aggregate, team exposure includes prescribers as well as other healthcare professionals.

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance at 3 or more IPE Events. Attendance at an event means active participation with two or more health professions students. IPE events at Husson are facilitated by faculty, and students are placed into small groups of 4-6, so the discussion can be monitored. Additionally, earners have to complete a self-assessment exploring specifics about what roles and responsibilities are displayed at IPE events and what their profession contributes.

Written critical reflections on what was learned at the IPE Event and how it might impact your future practice. This is part of the earner's portfolio, where they evaluate how their knowledge may impact their future practice. The reflection is then assessed by their professional faculty mentor.

Earners must also submit a robust, authentic interprofessional learning project, completed over the course of 2 years, and presented to an audience. This may include: AHEC Mini-Grant, Clarion Competition, IPE poster submission for research and scholarship day, professional conference IP Service Learning, Rural Immersion IPE activities, or an Interprofessional Clinical Rotation. A faculty mentor will provide feedback and evaluate the student’s eligibility for the IPE distinction.

0640270d-7323-4827-8eca-b6eac7f7fa85.description: The capacity to understand, analyze, and explain fundamental processes of development (such as conception, prenatal growth, birth, maturation, and aging) is central to a productive education in modern psychology. Earners of this badge have demonstrated proficiency analyzing cognitive, affective, and social life-span developments using evidence-based psychological concepts and theories in a formal APA-style manuscript.
0640270d-7323-4827-8eca-b6eac7f7fa85.name: Life-Span Development Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have, in a formal APA-style manuscript: constructed arguments on cognitive, affective, and social life-span developments using evidence-based psychological concepts and theories; incorporated appropriate levels of complexity (e.g., cellular, individual, group/system, societal/cultural) to explain behavior; and identified key characteristics of major content domains in psychology (e.g., cognition and learning, developmental, biological, and sociocultural).

2d5eaba4-51ba-4a6c-b8bc-c5ca173e3df0.description: Presenting oneself in a professional and polished manner is critical in landing jobs and internships, and completing the activities to earn this badge will give students the skills to be successful throughout their careers. Earners will learn key skills in professional etiquette and communication that will help them interview and network more effectively. These skills will help them successfully navigate the internship and job search process.
2d5eaba4-51ba-4a6c-b8bc-c5ca173e3df0.name: Professional Etiquette and Communication

alignments.name: National Association of Colleges and Employers Career Readiness Competencies: Career & Self-Development
alignments.description: Proactively develop oneself and one’s career through continual personal and professional learning, awareness of one’s strengths and weaknesses, navigation of career opportunities, and networking to build relationships within and without one’s organization

badge_template_activities.title: Through a practice interview with Career Services staff, the earner has demonstrated that they can easily articulate and explain interests, skills, and values through examples from work or educational experience.

Via the submission of an elevator pitch, the earner has demonstrated they can effectively and succinctly introduce themself in a social situation by explaining and discussing their interests, skills, and values showing why you are interested in a particular pathway.

The attending an industry standard professional event or an informational interview with a professional in a field the student has shown that they are able to ask specific questions and seek out new information that allowed them to evaluate career field in greater detail.

191016bd-0868-493d-a8b3-516b15e118fa.description: Presenting oneself professionally is critical as students reach out to employers for jobs and internships. Earning this badge will show that the student has carefully and thoughtfully created effective job search materials and is able to present themselves well as they apply for opportunities. The goal of these activities is to help the earner develop the skills to adapt their materials to a particular job title/pathway.
191016bd-0868-493d-a8b3-516b15e118fa.name: Professional Preparation Badge

alignments.name: National Association of Colleges and Employers Career Readiness Competencies: Career & Self-Development
alignments.description: Proactively develop oneself and one’s career through continual personal and professional learning, awareness of one’s strengths and weaknesses, navigation of career opportunities, and networking to build relationships within and without one’s organization.

badge_template_activities.title: Through the creation of a resume that is focused to a particular job title/career pathway the earner has effectively distinguished and explained the skills and abilities in strong examples to illustrate what they bring to a particular job title/pathway.

By creating a cover letter that is focused to a particular job title/career pathway the earner has distinguished and explained the skills and abilities in strong examples to show what they bring to a particular job title/pathway.

Through the creation of a LinkedIn profile that is focused to a particular job title/career pathway the earner has effectively and fully completed and focused each section with examples of skills and abilities that they bring to a job title/pathway.

9abe0bec-7ff0-444b-800f-06f81a91d9d6.description: The “community circle” or simply “circle” is a fundamental concept in restorative practices. Based on indigenous ways of knowing, being and engaging with others, community circles are used to informally address issues of conflict or misconduct from a perspective of restoration. Earners of this badge have participated in three, hour-long community circles that engaged the participants in active community building through Restorative Justice practices.
9abe0bec-7ff0-444b-800f-06f81a91d9d6.name: Restorative Justice Training I: Community Circle Participation

alignments.name: The Little Book of Restorative Justice for Colleges and Universities, Second Edition

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has participated in three, hour-long community building circles and through listening and conversation has engaged/applied Restorative Justice practice of community building.

e9deeed7-2cbd-452c-9809-bb476989727a.description: The term “co-keeper” is used to identify individuals who establish and maintain equalizing space in community circles, to encourage reflective listening and group conversations. Earners of this badge have earned the Restorative Justice Training I badge and have participated in three additional community building circles to gain co-keeping skills, which they demonstrate through circle facilitation.
e9deeed7-2cbd-452c-9809-bb476989727a.name: Restorative Justice Training II: Community Circle Co-Keeping

alignments.name: The Little Book of Restorative Justice for Colleges and Universities, Second Edition

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate co-keeping skills in three hour-long community build circles by establishing equalized spaces for discussions on Restorative Justice concepts including, but not limited to, harm repair, conventional and restorative thinking, and conflict and/or misconduct. Documentation of these demonstrations is recorded in a reflective essay that summarizes and synthesizes the earner’s co-keeping experiences in these circles, submitted to a DEI Inclusion Officer.
Restorative Justice Training I: Community Circle Participation

f37b5f8c-6b8e-4dee-b565-e50d021f2082.description: Community Circle Design requires a co-keeper skill set for guiding community circles through question rounds. It also requires capacities for closing circles out with an affirmation of theme or intent. Earners of this badge have earned the Restorative Justice Training I and II badges, completed three additional hour-long community circle activities, and documented their co-keeping skills with a written community building plan.
f37b5f8c-6b8e-4dee-b565-e50d021f2082.name: Restorative Justice Training III: Community Circles Design

alignments.name: The Little Book of Restorative Justice for Colleges and Universities, Second Edition

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed three, hour-long community circle activities and documented their co-keeping skills with a written community building plan. With this plan, they worked as co-keeper to guide a circle through five rounds of questions without pushing participants towards answers, and closed out a circle with an affirmation of theme or intent. This documentation is submitted for review to a DEI Inclusion Officer.
Restorative Justice Training II: Community Circle Co-Keeping
Restorative Justice Training I: Community Circle Participation

50c5b65c-46e0-4b76-8999-7e31239987e3.description: Earners of this badge can develop pivot tables and understand how to use charts and formulas in pivot tables. In Excel, data comparisons, patterns, and trends can be seen in data by using a pivot table to calculate, summarize, and analyze that data.
50c5b65c-46e0-4b76-8999-7e31239987e3.name: Spreadsheet Charts and Visualizations

badge_template_activities.title: Earners will create a time management and scheduling workbook. These real-world assessment models how a business could track and visualize a team of employees’ time. Additionally, students are asked to create charts and pivot tables, design and implement dashboards using functions, visualizations, and other features, and apply settings and modifications to print.

Earners will work in a Car Rental business workbook to compare data sets and select the data set that can be enhanced using visualizations. This includes designing pie charts using the provided data for a market analysis, and applying a pivot table to the data set to allow for visually appealing data analysis.

a2944fbd-e899-47a1-9836-3f9b530150a6.description: Earners of this badge have studied sophisticated techniques for handling and analyzing data in Excel and demonstrated the ability to: administer imports of large data sets and analyze and apply cleansing processes to data sets, create and use worksheet outlines and summarize worksheet data totals and subtotals, apply linking and consolidation of worksheets, apply data validation rules, create a what-if analysis and apply auditing options and settings.
a2944fbd-e899-47a1-9836-3f9b530150a6.name: Spreadsheet Data Management and Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: Earners will create a spreadsheet of inventory logs, general ledgers, and checklists, which are some examples of data points used in inventory management. This real-world assessment models how a business could track how much inventory they have and when and what they need to order. The inventory spreadsheet should provide insights into top-selling items, which can be tracked by region or season. For this spreadsheet, a large data set will be provided.

Earners will complete a baseball related worksheet to apply sequences of formulas that can be used to input the fundamental game-by-game and player statistics that are crucial for fans to track in order to predict possible game results and calculate how defeats can affect standings. Earners design and implement a data validation rule to the data set and analyze how the rule works, create a what-if analysis to determine how outcomes could change, and audit changes to the data set that was change

054b9ece-0378-4bd9-abec-978adc832d08.description: While utilizing Excel for analysis, formulas and functions are essential. In Excel, functions are predefined formulas. Earners of the Spreadsheet Functions and Formulas have shown that they are able to: apply dates and times; develop formulas, functions, and look ups; and, build conditional analysis and formatting.
054b9ece-0378-4bd9-abec-978adc832d08.name: Spreadsheet Functions and Formulas

badge_template_activities.title: While utilizing Excel for analysis, formulas and functions are essential. In Excel, functions are predefined formulas. Earners of the Spreadsheet Functions and Formulas have shown that they are able to: apply dates and times; develop formulas, functions, and look ups; and, build conditional analysis and formatting.

Earners develop a comprehensive mileage workbook that provides a “real world” hands-on demonstration of how functions and formulas can be used together to create a report for a given scenario. Earners apply fundamental formulas and data to a spreadsheet in practice by creating and updating the mileage and expenses in this multi-sheet workbook project.

4a327716-eea7-4754-b021-6b1c7f77501b.description: Psychological research design projects require critical capacities to identify problems, generate applicable questions, pursue a research agenda, and present key findings. Such work is necessarily grounded in reasonable practices for reviewing and processing field-related sources. Recipients of this badge have demonstrated proficiency with reading, summarizing, and evaluating psychological sources through a professional poster presentation.
4a327716-eea7-4754-b021-6b1c7f77501b.name: Validating Psychological Sources

badge_template_activities.title: In a professional poster presentation, earners have demonstrated they are able to: evaluate arguments clearly and concisely using evidence-based psychological concepts and theories from psychological sources and examine, summarize, and assess general ideas and conclusions from psychological sources accurately.
